segment.source: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot endpoint protection in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot endpoint protection in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot endpoint protection in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot endpoint protection in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Resources to help you solve Endpoint Protection problems
segment.target: Resources to help you solve Endpoint Protection problems

segment.source: Use the information in this section to help you solve problems while using .
segment.target: Use the information in this section to help you solve problems while using .

segment.source: Endpoint Protection error messages
segment.target: Endpoint Protection error messages

segment.source: This section describes potential causes and solutions for the following errors and warnings, which appear in the Endpoint Protection Status pane in the .
segment.target: This section describes potential causes and solutions for the following errors and warnings, which appear in the Endpoint Protection Status pane in the .

segment.source: Status item
segment.target: Status item

segment.source: Potential causes
segment.target: Potential causes

segment.source: Potential solutions
segment.target: Potential solutions

segment.source: Endpoint Protection engine unavailable
segment.target: Endpoint Protection engine unavailable

segment.source: The engine was corrupted or deleted.
segment.target: The engine was corrupted or deleted.

segment.source: If the engine is corrupted, you can try updating or reinstalling the software.
segment.target: If the engine is corrupted, you can try updating or reinstalling the software.

segment.source: To force an immediate update, click Update in the client software (found in the taskbar on managed computers.
segment.target: To force an immediate update, click Update in the client software (found in the taskbar on managed computers.

segment.source: If the engine cannot be updated, you must reinstall the engine.
segment.target: If the engine cannot be updated, you must reinstall the engine.

segment.source: In the list of installed programs in Control Panel on the managed computer, locate Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection Agent, and then uninstall the application.
segment.target: In the list of installed programs in Control Panel on the managed computer, locate Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection Agent, and then uninstall the application.

segment.source: During the next update synchronization, the Microsoft Online Management Update Manager detects the missing program and reinstalls it at the scheduled installation time.
segment.target: During the next update synchronization, the Microsoft Online Management Update Manager detects the missing program and reinstalls it at the scheduled installation time.

segment.source: Endpoint Protection disabled
segment.target: Endpoint Protection disabled

segment.source: was disabled by an administrator using a policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: was disabled by an administrator using a policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Enable Endpoint Protection setting in the policies that apply to the computer.
segment.target: To enable from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Enable Endpoint Protection setting in the policies that apply to the computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable from a managed computer, start the client from the notification area and you will be prompted to enable .
segment.target: to enable from a managed computer, start the client from the notification area and you will be prompted to enable .

segment.source: Real-time protection disabled
segment.target: Real-time protection disabled

segment.source: Real-time protection was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: Real-time protection was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If real-time protection is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If real-time protection is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable real-time protection from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Enable real-time protection setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.
segment.target: To enable real-time protection from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Enable real-time protection setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable real-time protection from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable real-time protection from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: You are prompted to enable real-time protection at that time.
segment.target: You are prompted to enable real-time protection at that time.

segment.source: Download scanning disabled
segment.target: Download scanning disabled

segment.source: Download scanning was disabled by an administrator by using policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: Download scanning was disabled by an administrator by using policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If download scanning is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If download scanning is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable download scanning from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Scan all Downloads setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.
segment.target: To enable download scanning from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Scan all Downloads setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable download scanning from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable download scanning from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Scan all downloads check box, and then click Save changes.
segment.target: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Scan all downloads check box, and then click Save changes.

segment.source: File and program activity monitoring disabled
segment.target: File and program activity monitoring disabled

segment.source: File and program activity monitoring was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: File and program activity monitoring was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If file and program activity monitoring is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If file and program activity monitoring is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable file and program activity monitoring from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Monitor file and program activity on computers setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.
segment.target: To enable file and program activity monitoring from the , open the Policy workspace, and then change the Monitor file and program activity on computers setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable file and program activity monitoring from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable file and program activity monitoring from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Monitor file and program activity on your computer check box, and then click Save changes.
segment.target: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Monitor file and program activity on your computer check box, and then click Save changes.

segment.source: Behavior monitoring disabled
segment.target: Behavior monitoring disabled

segment.source: Behavior monitoring was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: Behavior monitoring was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If behavior monitoring is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If behavior monitoring is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable behavior monitoring from the , open the Policy workspace, change the Enable behavior monitoring setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer, and then restart the managed computer.
segment.target: To enable behavior monitoring from the , open the Policy workspace, change the Enable behavior monitoring setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer, and then restart the managed computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable behavior monitoring from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable behavior monitoring from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable behavior monitoring check box, and then click Save changes.
segment.target: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable behavior monitoring check box, and then click Save changes.

segment.source: Then, restart the computer.
segment.target: Then, restart the computer.

segment.source: Script scanning disabled
segment.target: Script scanning disabled

segment.source: Script scanning was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: Script scanning was disabled by an administrator who used Policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If script scanning is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If script scanning is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable script scanning from the , open the Policy workspace and change the Enable script scanning setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.
segment.target: To enable script scanning from the , open the Policy workspace and change the Enable script scanning setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable script scanning from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable script scanning from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable script scanning check box, and then click Save changes.
segment.target: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable script scanning check box, and then click Save changes.

segment.source: Network Inspection System disabled
segment.target: Network Inspection System disabled

segment.source: The Network Inspection System was disabled by an administrator using policy or by a user on a managed computer.
segment.target: The Network Inspection System was disabled by an administrator using policy or by a user on a managed computer.

segment.source: If Network Inspection System is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.
segment.target: If Network Inspection System is disabled, you can enable it from the or from a managed computer.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: To enable Network Inspection System from the , open the Policy workspace, change the Enable Network Inspection System setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer, and then restart the managed computer.
segment.target: To enable Network Inspection System from the , open the Policy workspace, change the Enable Network Inspection System setting to Yes in the policies that apply to the computer, and then restart the managed computer.

segment.source: Or,
segment.target: Or,

segment.source: to enable Network Inspection System from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.
segment.target: to enable Network Inspection System from a managed computer, start the client software from the notification area.

segment.source: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable Network Inspection System check box, and then click Save changes.
segment.target: Click the Settings tab, click Real-time protection, select the Enable Network Inspection System check box, and then click Save changes.

segment.source: Restart the computer.
segment.target: Restart the computer.

segment.source: Malware definitions out-of-date
segment.target: Malware definitions out-of-date

segment.source: The computer might have been disconnected from the Internet for an extended period of time, and its malware definitions might not yet have been updated.
segment.target: The computer might have been disconnected from the Internet for an extended period of time, and its malware definitions might not yet have been updated.

segment.source: This status appears when the malware definitions on the computer are out-of-date by 14 days or more.
segment.target: This status appears when the malware definitions on the computer are out-of-date by 14 days or more.

segment.source: If malware definitions are out-of-date, you can update the definitions from the or from the managed computer.
segment.target: If malware definitions are out-of-date, you can update the definitions from the or from the managed computer.

segment.source: For more information, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune topic.
segment.target: For more information, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune topic.

segment.source: Full scan overdue
segment.target: Full scan overdue

segment.source: A full scan has not been completed for 14 days.
segment.target: A full scan has not been completed for 14 days.

segment.source: This can be caused by a computer restart during a full scan.
segment.target: This can be caused by a computer restart during a full scan.

segment.source: If a full scan is overdue, you can run a one-time full scan or schedule recurring full scans from the by using the information in the topic Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.
segment.target: If a full scan is overdue, you can run a one-time full scan or schedule recurring full scans from the by using the information in the topic Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.

segment.source: Quick scan overdue
segment.target: Quick scan overdue

segment.source: A quick scan has not been completed for 14 days.
segment.target: A quick scan has not been completed for 14 days.

segment.source: This can be caused by a restart during a quick scan.
segment.target: This can be caused by a restart during a quick scan.

segment.source: If a quick scan is overdue, you can run a one-time quick scan or schedule recurring quick scans from the by using the information in the topic Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.
segment.target: If a quick scan is overdue, you can run a one-time quick scan or schedule recurring quick scans from the by using the information in the topic Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.

segment.source: Another endpoint protection application running
segment.target: Another endpoint protection application running

segment.source: Another endpoint protection application is running, and the computer is healthy.
segment.target: Another endpoint protection application is running, and the computer is healthy.

segment.source: By default, if another endpoint protection application is installed and detects that application, automatically disables itself.
segment.target: By default, if another endpoint protection application is installed and detects that application, automatically disables itself.

segment.source: If does not detect the other endpoint application, will remain enabled.
segment.target: If does not detect the other endpoint application, will remain enabled.

segment.source: For more information, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
